name: SizeBlock
description: Levels are represented as labyrinths with loads of traps, jigsaws and other challenges. The task is simple – just bring the cube to the final destination… However, that’s not that simple as it seems! Some of the obstacles can change, size, shape and even behavior of your cube!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP and newer Processor: 2.0+ GHz Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: Integrated Graphics Storage: 70 MB available space Sound Card: Integrated Audio

reviews.review_text: the controls are horrible its like trying to put a screw in with a fork. the block move speed is set to really fast and when you need to squeeze into tight spot its really really hard to stop where you need to. in most games like this and even on the **** atari if you held the direction you wanted to go before you got to that point you went in that direction not on this game and since the whole point of the game is moving a box to an exact coordinate this game fails for me.

Very short game with a playtime of 10-20 Minutes. Graphics are okay for such a small game, music and sound too. Gameplay could be good, but:  1. It's WAY too easy 2. and glitchy  I've played it with a controller (you still need the keyboard then) and was able to move through the walls with the blocks in levels where you have to controll two of them. This bug doesn't seem possible while playing with the keyboard, but it bothers me a little bit, that the blocks don't have to be on their goal. It's enough when they have at least touched it.  So, is it worth the price or not? Well, if you want to have some fun for a few minutes and want to support a small team of developers, then why not. Would they add more levels with higher difficulties and maybe some more puzzles, fix the bugs, then it would be a good game.

Simple casual puzzle. It is necessary to go rolling a block on a labyrinth to the exit. On some levels will be first to eat up blocks each other, and last to roll to the exit. If there is one more block on levels, then commuted on a management each by numbers 1 and 2.  An interface in a game is a very minimalism. In a game 35 easy enough levels that is passed very quickly. Estimation: 6/10
